page.title: 18LANDSCAPE OF LLANBISTER
page.content: Llanbister nestles in the gentle folds of the hills. Below, the Ithon meanders through a patchwork of fields and laid hedges.The majority of fields being under 10 acres, with large areas of riverside pasture. Scattered small oak woods and alder grow on the valley sides. Common land of gorse and bracken border the farms. The houses, constructed from local stone under slate roofs, sometimes brick framed, are in harmony with the natural contours of the land. Farm buildings are stone, brick and part timberframed and boarded. One cruk framed longhouse is still lived in. The 13th cent.Parish Church built of stone under slate has fine timber work in the roof and a music gallery of 1716.The tower is at the east end. Llananno Church has a very fine 16th. cent. rood screen.
